alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 12:55PM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible, especially on the central and southern Tug Hill. Total snow accumulations of 7 inches or more possible in the most persistent lake snows. * WHERE...Oswego and Lewis counties. The greater snow accumulation into this evening will be restricted to the higher terrain of the Tug Hill Plateau and western Adirondacks, with much lower accumulations for lower elevation areas. The heaviest lake effect snow Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon will be across the central and southern Tug Hill Plateau. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially during the heavy lake effect snow. The hazardous conditions from lake effect could impact the morning commute on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Periods of snow will result in snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving. Submit snow reports through our website or social media. Narrow bands of heavy snow could impact portions of the region. Localized travel problems will be possible.
